We are so grateful for Ben Jordan's talent and ingenuity during the seven vintages he led our winemaking team at Early Mountain. During his tenure, Early Mountain wines gained national recognition with his thoughtful, expressive winemaking setting a new standard. We wish him well as he departs Early Mountain to focus on a new project in the Shenandoah Valley. Since its founding, Early Mountain has celebrated and supported the continued growth of the Virginia wine industry, and we are proud Ben takes this same ethos to his new venture. The baton has been officially passed to our Lead Winemaker Maya Hood White. Join us in raising a glass to Ben!‚Å†

On this #NationalWineDay we are celebrating the innovation and bright future of Virginia wine. 

Maya fell in love with Virginia wine and the cutting-edge agricultural practices required in Virginia‚Äôs unpredictable winemaking conditions. We are thrilled to have such vision and talent at the helm of our wine-growing innovations. ‚Å†

 ‚ÄúWhile I never planned to stay in Virginia wine country, the opportunity at Early Mountain to farm extraordinary vineyard sites like Quaker Run, while also being supported to use innovation and cutting-edge agricultural practices to respond to ever-changing vintages, really drew me in.
